Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice with part of handle; glazed fired orange white slip; interior glazed; added white and red bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of male leg (from mid-thigh) in outline to right; below, two lines above set of vertical strokes to left of handle root; band below.
Curator's comments: Contrary to the norm, where male flesh is usually coloured brown to red, the flesh on this cup is depicted in outline, a manner usually reserved for female figures.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 278, no. 753, pl. III)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0731) (phase 2)
